Posts.Title: My annual fund-raising stand-up routine - need more material !

Posts.Content: Hi, I already had dry skin before I started chemotherapy, but now my face and eyes are so dry and sore. I use day creams and night creams but need to reapply every 3-4 hours (meaning I have to take off and reapply makeup twice a day too) Any suggestions for creams or oils that work best for the face?
Posts.Title: Dry skin and eyes

Posts.Content: Hi, I shaved mine yesterday, my husband actually says he prefers me bald to wearing a scarf! I went shopping today and felt less people stared than when I wore a head cover! I've just done chemo 2 of 6. I also have the smoothest armpits I've ever had in my life - that's a bonus!! I could be an armpit model! Yes I'm also piling on the pounds too.... Good luck with your treatment x Gillian
Posts.Title: I've done it! Shaved my head today...

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm fairly new to this too, and just had my 3rd chemotherapy session (surgery and radiotherapy lie ahead). My family reactions have varied over time and from person to person. Especially as they've seen me change through treatment (losing hair and energy). It took time even for me to start to comprehend this and I still vary with my emotions day to day (today was not a good day for the lady from CAMHS to tell me they can't offer support for my son restarting school at 13 after exclusions - think she wished I didn't answer the phone). Be patient with them and yourself, it really is an unexpected journey x Gillian
Posts.Title: Loved ones' strange reaction

Posts.Content: It's hormone receptor positive, and the oncologist did say there will be ongoing treatment after chemo, surgery and radiotherapy (so I guess that's tamoxifen?). My kids are 10 and 13, the 13 year old though has behavioural problems and is emotionally about age 7. Thanks for replying-it's so tiring and a strange new world. I want to go back to my old life. I spoke with the chemo nurse last night, she thinks the filgrastin injections I'm using might be making me feel like this - last one today so hopefully better soon.
Posts.Title: Post Chemo - when will I start feeling better?

Posts.Content: Thank you. I'm 43, Mum of 2 and was diagnosed with a grade 3, 40mm HER-ve tumour in the left breast 5weeks ago. I've always been really independent and never thought about getting ill (really don't like illness much!). My husband is totally unused to taking care of things (although he is trying), and the kids are being fabulous although they are being rocked by the diagnosis too. I am waiting on genetic tests and the 6cycles of TAC before deciding on what surgery will be x
Posts.Title: Post Chemo - when will I start feeling better?

Posts.Content: I am 6days since my first TAC chemotherapy and gradually feeling worse.  Tired and achy, no motivation...... Any tips on how to improve this feeling? I suspect some of this is delayed shock (i haven't dealt with emotional side of diagnosis at all), but the idea of feeling like this for months is terrible. All ideas appreciated x
Posts.Title: Post Chemo - when will I start feeling better?

Posts.Content: Hello, I am now 11 days post my first TAC chemotherapy. I didn't use a cold cap. So I guess I'm expecting my hair to start falling out, but it hasn't yet. My question is when it starts what is it like? Could I wake up in the morning fine, walk the dog, get to the supermarket and find I start shedding? Do I need to carry a scarf with me everywhere I go now? Any experience please?
Posts.Title: TAC and hair loss

Posts.Content: They are the different drugs in the chemo cocktail you are given. The oncologist makes the recommendation. You don't have to have chemo, I could have chosen just to have surgery and radiotherapy, but the risk that it had spread further made chemotherapy a logical choice (hair seems a small sacrifice - although I'm not looking forward to losing it x). Good luck x
Posts.Title: TAC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Thanks, I'm having all three drugs each time. Every 3 weeks for 6 cycles. My oncologist said I'm "lucky" as because I'm quite young (43) and healthy they would give me a really strong treatment. It's grade 3, stage 3 apparently. I think my idea of lucky is different than his! I just don't want to go to a meeting in the  morning and find my hair suddenly falls out and I'm unprepared x
